Data.event_text: 8 January  17 people are killed and 22 others injured when a truck hits a funeral procession in Nanchang County, Jiangxi.

links.text: -"17 killed, 22 injured in eastern China road accident, state media reports". SCMP. 2023-01-08.-

Data.event_text: 11 January  2023 Guangzhou car attack Five people are killed and 13 others injured when a man rams his vehicle into a crowd in Guangzhou, Guangdong.

links.text: -"China: Five dead after man drives into crowd in Guangzhou". BBC News. 2023-01-12. Retrieved 2023-01-12.-

Data.event_text: 17 January  2023 Nyingchi avalanche An avalanche in Nyingchi, Tibet, kills 28 people.

links.text: -"Tibet avalanche kills 28 as search called off". BBC News. 21 January 2023.-

Data.event_text: 4 February  At least 16 people are killed and 66 others injured in a multiple-vehicle collision along a highway in Changsha, Hunan.

links.text: -cue (2023-02-05). "Sixteen killed, dozens injured in China highway pile-up | The Straits Times". www.straitstimes.com. Retrieved 2023-02-05.-

Data.event_text: 12 February  2023 Shandong high-altitude object China said that it detected an unidentified flying object over the Yellow Sea, and warns that it is prepared to shoot it down. The Qingdao Marine Development Bureau issues an alert to fishermen in the waters to be "on alert" and "avoid risks".

links.text: -"China spots mystery object over waters near northern port city". South China Morning Post. 2023-02-12. Retrieved 2023-02-13.-

Data.event_text: 22 February  Alxa Left Banner mine collapse 53 people are killed by a collapse at a coal mine in Alxa League, Inner Mongolia.

links.text: -"Search and rescue mission launched after coal mine collapses in China". BBC News. 2023-02-22. Retrieved 2023-02-22.-

Data.event_text: 19 April  2023 Beijing hospital fire Twenty-nine people are killed by a fire in a hospital in Beijing.
13 May  Li Haoshi controversy
28 May  First flight of the Comac C919, China's first domestically made passenger aircraft, takes place between Shanghai Hongqiao Airport and Beijing Capital Airport.

links.text: -"Chinese-made passenger plane makes first commercial flight". Honolulu Star-Advertiser. 29 May 2023. Retrieved 9 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 June  19 people are killed by a landslide at a mine in Leshan city of Sichuan.

links.text: -"Landslide at mine in China's Sichuan province kills 19". Reuters.-

Data.event_text: 21 June  2023 Yinchuan gas explosion At least 31 people are killed and seven injured by a gas explosion at a barbecue restaurant in the city of Yinchuan in the northwest Ningxia region. The explosion was caused by a leak in a liquefied gas tank inside the restaurant.

links.text: -"31 dead after gas explosion at barbecue restaurant in China". CNN.-

Data.event_text: 10 July  Six people, including three children, are killed and one injured in an early morning knife attack at a kindergarten in Lianjiang, Guangdong.

links.text: -"Six killed in stabbing at a Kindergarten in China, suspect arrested". Al JAZEERA.-

Data.event_text: 23 July  2023 Qiqihar school gymnasium collapse 11 people are killed by the collapse of a school gym in Qiqihar, Heilongjiang.

2 August  Typhoon Doksuri brings heavy rainfall to Beijing and Hebei. In Changping, it sets a maximum rainfall record since record-keeping began in 1883. At least 80 people are killed and 35 missing by flooding in localities of Beijing, Hebei, Jilin and Liaoning.

links.text: -"Impact of floods in China after Typhoon Doksuri". Reuters. 9 August 2023. Retrieved 9 August 2023.-

Data.event_text: 11 August  24 people are killed and 3 are missing after a flash flood and landslides in the village of Weiziping in Chang'an, Xi'an.

links.text: -"21 killed, 6 missing after floods, landslides strike Xi'an". China Daily.-

Data.event_text: 8 September  Flooding occurs in Guangdong and Fujian province in southern China after Typhon Haikui makes landfall over the region. Rainfall in Shenzhen reaches record levels, the heaviest since meteorological records began in the city.

links.text: -Siu, Tyrone; Master, Farah; Siu, Tyrone; Master, Farah (2023-09-08). "Hong Kong, Shenzhen deluged by heaviest rain on record". Reuters. Retrieved 2023-09-08.-

Data.event_text: 22 September  Syrian President Bashar al-Assad visits China, meets with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, and signs a strategic partnership with China on infrastructure as part of China's Belt and Road Initiative.

links.text: -"Xi, Assad jointly announce China-Syria strategic partnership-Xinhua". english.news.cn. Retrieved 2023-09-22.-

Data.event_text: 13 October  An Israeli diplomat based at the Embassy of Israel, Beijing is stabbed by an unknown foreign attacker. The diplomat was taken to a hospital for treatment and is in stable condition. The incident is being treated as a terrorist attack.

links.text: -"An employee at the Israeli Embassy in China has been stabbed. A foreign suspect is detained". AP News. 2023-10-13. Retrieved 2023-10-13.-

Data.event_text: 17 October  Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán and Russian President Vladimir Putin hold talks at the Belt and Road Initiative forum in Beijing. It is the first meeting between Putin and an EU leader since Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

links.text: -"Putin meets Hungarian Prime Minister Orbán in first meeting with EU leader since invasion of Ukraine". AP News. 2023-10-17. Retrieved 2023-10-17.-

Data.event_text: 24 October  The Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of China votes to remove several state council members from their positions, including defense minister Li Shangfu, finance minister Liu Kun, and science minister Wang Zhigang.

links.text: -"China removes Li Shangfu as defence minister". CNA. Retrieved 2023-10-24.-

Data.event_text: 10 November  China imposes "control measures" against Philippine vessels at a contested South China Sea location after a Philippine auxiliary ship entered the area which China deemed as infringing on its sovereignty.

links.text: -"China says took 'control measures' against Philippine ships in its waters". The Times of India. 2023-11-10. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 2023-11-10.-
-"China says took 'control measures' against Philippine ships in its waters". The Times of India. 2023-11-10. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 2023-11-10.-

Data.event_text: 13 November  2023 Chinese pneumonia outbreak National Health Commission reports a pneumonia outbreak in Beijing and Liaoning.

links.text: -"WHO asks China for details on respiratory illness outbreaks". Reuters. November 23, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 15 November  U.S. President Joe Biden and Xi Jinping hold talks in San Francisco, California, United States, their first meeting in over a year. The talks are described as being positive with "real progress" being made on key issues such as drug trafficking and artificial intelligence.

links.text: -Hunnicutt, Trevor; Mason, Jeff; Holland, Steve; Mason, Jeff (2023-11-16). "Biden, Xi's 'blunt' talks yield deals on military, fentanyl". Reuters. Retrieved 2023-11-16.-

Data.event_text: 16 November  Lüliang office fire At least 26 people are killed and 63 were hospitalized by a fire at the Yongju Coal Industry Joint Building in Lüliang, Shanxi.

links.text: -"26 dead in north China building fire - state media". BBC News. 2023-11-16. Retrieved 2023-11-16.-

Data.event_text: 21 November  The Chinese Foreign Ministry warns Argentina against severing ties as a "serious mistake", after president-elect Javier Milei vowed to do so.

links.text: -Woo, Ryan; Wang, Ethan (2023-11-21). "China warns Argentina severing ties would be 'serious mistake'". Reuters. Retrieved 2023-11-21.-

Data.event_text: 27 November  A Chinese court commences compensation hearings for the Chinese relatives of passengers on Malaysia Airlines Flight 370.

links.text: -Chen, Laurie (2023-11-27). "Chinese families of missing Malaysia MH370 plane seek compensation in court". Reuters. Retrieved 2023-11-28.-

Data.event_text: 6 December  Archaeologists discover an ancient Han dynasty tomb.

links.text: -(Yahoo! News)-

Data.event_text: 14 December  2023 Beijing Subway collision At least 515 people are injured in a rear-end collision between railroad cars on the Beijing Subway near the Xi'erqi station amid snowfall.

links.text: -"Over 500 people injured in Beijing train collision amid heavy snow". 1 News. Retrieved 2023-12-15.-

Data.event_text: 20 December  Twelve people are killed and 13 others injured when a mining cart runs off the tracks in Jixi, Heilongjiang.

links.text: -"Coal mine cart runs off the tracks in northeastern China, killing 12 workers". AP News. 2023-12-21. Retrieved 2023-12-21.-

Data.event_text: 22 December  China passes a series of regulations aimed at limiting video game microtransactions. The new rules include banning rewards for logging on for multiple consecutive days and banning rewards for players if they spend money in a game for the first time.

links.text: -DiCarlo, John (2023-12-22). "China Implements Strict New Gaming Laws". Game Rant. Retrieved 2023-12-23.-

Data.event_text: 29 December  The National People's Congress of China appoints commander of the People's Liberation Army Navy Dong Jun as the Minister of National Defense, succeeding Li Shangfu.

links.text: -"China appoints new defence minister to replace ousted Li Shangfu". CNA. Retrieved 2023-12-29.-
